greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of multisets of k odd numbers with a cap of the total sum set to n.
comment: By considering the partitions of n into k parts we set a cap on the odd numbers of each part and count the multisets (ordered k-tuples) of odd numbers where each number is not larger than the cap of its part.
Multiset transformation of A110654 or A065033.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..200, flattened
Index entries for triangles generated by the Multiset Transformation
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{c_i*N_i=n,i=1..k} binomial(T(N_i,1)+c_i-1,c_i) for 1 < k <= n.
example: T(6,2) = 3+2+3 = 8 counts {1,1} {1,3}, and {3,3} from taking two odd numbers <= 3; it counts {1,1} and {1,3} from taking an odd number <= 2 and an odd number <= 4; and it counts {1,1}, {1,3} and {1,5} from taking an odd number <= 1 and an odd number <= 5.

T(6,3) = 1+2+2 = 5 counts {1,1,1} from taking three odd numbers <= 2; it counts {1,1,1} and {1,1,3} from taking an odd number <= 1 and an odd number <= 2 and an odd number <= 3; and it counts {1,1,1} and {1,1,3} from taking two odd numbers <= 1 and an odd number <= 4.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; `if`(p>n, 0, `if`(n=0, 1,
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..16);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 13 2017
mathematica: b[n_, i_, p_] := b[n, i, p] = If[p > n, 0, If[n == 0, 1, If[Min[i, p] < 1, 0, Sum[b[n - i*j, i - 1, p - j]*Binomial[Ceiling[i/2] + j - 1, j], {j, 0, Min[n/i, p]}]]]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 16}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 19 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A110654 (column 1), A003293 (row sums?), A089353 (equivalent Multiset transformation of A000027), A005232 (2nd column?), A097513 (3rd column?).
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 27 2016
